q: How do I determine the correct size for my flood gate?
a: Measure the clear opening width and height, then add 2 inches for side-seal compression. Our engineers verify dimensions during the site survey process. Gates over 8 ft require mid-span reinforcement to meet ASTM E330 deflection limits.

q: Can one flood gate cover multiple doorways?
a: Yes—modular gates can span adjoining doorways up to 12 ft using coupler plates. Each segment retains independent seals, simplifying replacement. See Modular Flood Barrier specs.

q: What clearance do I need above the sill?
a: At least 3 inches of unobstructed vertical clearance ensures full gasket compression and quick deployment. Trim decorative thresholds as required.

q: How high should the barrier be relative to flood level?
a: Height = Design Flood Elevation (BFE + 1 ft freeboard) – finished floor. Our software calculates optimum height for each zone (Sarasota, Naples etc.).

q: Are oversize flood gates difficult to operate?
a: No—panels under 80 lb include recessed handles and assisted clamps. Larger assemblies use counterbalanced hinges or motorized lifts.
